Data and Visualization Resources

June 26, 2013 Tags: Communication Design Science Code

Thanks for everyone who came to the #sci4hels panel, we had a blast!! Several of you asked for a more detailed list of resources and tools for visualizing data. This is by no means a comprehensive list, but just a taste of what's out there to get you started exploring and visualizing data on your own. Get in touch if you know of other good resources!


Data Gathering

Guardian Open Datastore and How-To Guide

Data.gov

Government Open Data

State Legislature Downloads (regularly updated)

FOIA Examples and templates

FOIA Letter generator (download file)

NOAA's National Climatic Data Center

Center for Medicare and Medicaid Data


Data Extracting, Processing and Designing

PDF to Excel Converter

Mr. Data Converter

ProPublica's Data Bulletproofing Guide

Scraping guide from the ProPublica nerds

Extract an HTML table to Google Docs

Google Refine

Berkeley (Knight Media Foundation) Â basic guide to Google spreadsheets

Data Journalism Workflow by The Guardian

My Favorite (Excel) Things

Design Principles for News Apps and Graphics


Data Visualization Tools/Tutorials

Google Fusion Tables

TileMill

Tableau

Highcharts

Interactive Bar/Fever Chart Generator

jQuery Sparklines

TimelineSetter

Timeline.js

WNYC Vertical Timeline

John Keefe's Mapping Tutorial

Michelle Minkoff's Graphing Tutorial


Data Visualization Blogs

Guardian Datablog

Flowing Data

Stephen Few's Visual Business Intelligence

Alberto Cairo's Functional Art

The Daily Viz

Chartsnthings

Junk Charts

Information Aesthetics

Eagereyes

Visualising Data

Fell in Love with Data


Also a great list of resources from Peter Aldhous (@paldhous)

And if you want to dive into programming a bit more, I wrote a blog post on the books/tutorials/websites that helped me learn to code.
